alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 1:18AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL KIMBLE COUNTY THROUGH 200 AM CDT... At 118 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line, or near South Llano River State Park, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Segovia, I-10 Near The Kimble- Kerr County Line, The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290, and Us- 83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 461 and 477. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
